text: Hello everyone, not sure where to post this. Being a newb at programming and Linux, I seem to have borked my system somehow. I was trying to follow along Tom Kwong's awesome video on TextAnalysis.jl, when I started experiencing some weird problems loading OhMyREPL and Pluto. Both packages seem to precompile forever, and then I get `StackOverflowError`s. My question is whether to report these as issues/bugs, and if so where? I downloaded `rr` and created a trace of my startup (since I had OhMyREPL in my `startup.jl` file). Given that I am getting the same error for two different packages, I don't think this needs to be reported under either but perhaps under the Julia project itself.

text:
Here is the one report I created: <https://s3.amazonaws.com/julialang-dumps/reports/2020-12-24T18-11-08-EarthGoddessDude.tar.zst>

I disabled my `starup.jl` file, and was going to try to create a report loading `OhMyREPL` and `Pluto` from the REPL, but now I'm getting a `StackOverflowError` loading the `BugReporting` package with `julia --bug-report=rr`...:sweat_smile:

```[~]$ julia --bug-report=rr
[ Info: Loading BugReporting package...
ERROR: StackOverflowError:```
